caption: Originally part of the Palace, pre Revolution, this very elegant building remains as the entrance to a museum. Sited at the Louvre end of the Pont Du Carrousel it can be clearly seen from across the river.
Part of the palace complex, this structure is a stunning entrance
Pleasant view from outside as well. One must be careful from scavengers. I was saved by a lady. Thanks to her and was told be careful not to sympathize with them as they mostly rob
Stunning entrance to a world class museum
Superb, like the entire Louvre Palace of course

When I stand in front of the Pavillon de la Trémoille, I am immediately fascinated by its beauty and attention to detail. The pavilion is part of the huge Louvre complex, but it has its own character. It rises majestically at the northwest corner of the Louvre, and although it may seem inconspicuous in the overall picture of the museum, it captivates me in a very special way.  The Pavillon de la Trémoille, named after a French noble family, is a perfect example of the fusion of art and architecture. I look at the ornate facades, decorated with beautiful sculptures and reliefs. Every column, every window frame is designed with such great attention to detail that I can't help but stop to admire all these details. The figures on the facade seem almost alive, as if they want to tell stories of times gone by.  As I approach, I notice the harmonious mix of classical and baroque elements. The symmetrical structure of the pavilion exudes elegance and calm, while the elaborate decorations convey liveliness and dynamism.  Particularly impressive are the large, curved windows and balustrades, which give the building a regal grandeur.  I imagine how many centuries this pavilion has survived, how it has witnessed the changes and expansions of the Louvre. It is as if the Pavillon de la Trémoille holds a permanent place in the city's history while representing the timeless splendor of French architecture.  As I walk away from the pavilion, I stand for a moment and take one last look at this artistic structure. I was deeply impressed by the harmony between the fine details and the monumental structure, and I feel that this pavilion is a hidden gem within the gigantic expanse of the Louvre.  As of: December 22, 2023
Fascinating beauty not to be missed
